title: new way to push errors all the way up complicates --dbg troubleshooting
body:
While looking at #1696  `--on-failure=stop`  worked out splendidly and stopped whenever first install failed! 
but also it stopped somewhat suboptimally with `--dbg` since now I just ending up somewhere in `datalad/interface/utils.py` while handling `incomplete_results` which resulted from the original exception I wanted to investigate, instead of that very exception... I wonder if we could do anything about that since it makes `--dbg` mode is largely useless

```
alchen@discovery:/mnt/scratch/yoh$ rm -rf datasets.datalad.org;  datalad install ///; datalad --dbg --on-failure=stop install -r datasets.datalad.org/adhd200
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'http://datasets.datalad.org/' (trying 2 location candidate(s)) to '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org' 
install(ok): /mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org (dataset)
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'http://datasets.datalad.org/adhd200/.git' (trying 1 location candidate(s)) to '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200' 
[ERROR  ] Installation of subdatasets /mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200 failed with exception: SHA could not be resolved, git returned: '' [cmd.py:_parse_object_header:891] [install(/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200)] 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/datalad", line 8, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/cmdline/main.py", line 348, in main
    ret = cmdlineargs.func(cmdlineargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/base.py", line 424, in call_from_parser
    ret = list(ret)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 707, in generator_func
    msg="Command did not complete successfully")
IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully [{'status': 'error', 'action': 'install', 'path': '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200', 'type': 'dataset', 'message': ('Installation of subdatasets %s failed with exception: %s', '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200', "SHA could not be resolved, git returned: '' [cmd.py:_parse_object_header:891]")}]
()
> /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py(707)generator_func()
-> msg="Command did not complete successfully")
(Pdb) l
702                                     for act in sorted(action_summary))))
703     
704                 if incomplete_results:
705                     raise IncompleteResultsError(
706                         failed=incomplete_results,
707  ->                     msg="Command did not complete successfully")
708     
709             if return_type == 'generator':
710                 # hand over the generator
711                 return generator_func(*args, **kwargs)
712             else:
(Pdb) p incomplete_results
[{'status': 'error', 'action': 'install', 'path': '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200', 'type': 'dataset', 'message': ('Installation of subdatasets %s failed with exception: %s', '/mnt/scratch/yoh/datasets.datalad.org/adhd200', "SHA could not be resolved, git returned: '' [cmd.py:_parse_object_header:891]")}]
```

if original exception was propagated up as well (not just a message with some details), at least there may be was a chance to get to that frame?
